result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ramon Martinez

records.addlTxt: COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Defendant Ramon Martinez not in court.  Attorney Sam Obscherning appeared by video for Ramon Martinez.  Prosecuting attorney Sarah Dahdouh in court for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for status conference.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued forthwith. COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT. Court takes no action as to bail.

Defendant Ramon Martinez not in court.  Attorney Sam Obscherning appeared by video for Ramon Martinez.  Prosecuting attorney Sarah Dahdouh in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant's appearance waived by the Court as this matter was scheduled for 8/22/2022 and Attorney Obscherning was unable to pass the Milwaukee County health protocol screening. 
Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 30.
This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.
Status conference scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Ramon Martinez in court with attorney Sam Obscherning.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Ramon Martinez appeared by video means with Attorney.
Case in court for calendar call. Defendant appears. Court vacates stayed warrant. 
Defense in receipt of discovery and offer and requests an adjournment. Case adjourned to br 30.  Status conference scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Attorney Sam Obscherning in court.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by video means for .  
Case in Court for Pretrial conference. Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next court date. Case remains calendared in Br. 30.  Calendar call scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Macy's at 2500 N Mayfair Road, Wauwatosa, WI.

DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 04/29/2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Ramon Martinez in court.  John Daniel Flynn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 30 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 04/27/2022@02:00pm
